text.author: Supreme Court of India
text.summary: Attorney Menaka Guruswamy asks for same-sex marriage to be accommodated within the Hindu Marriage Act based on its reform as statutory law, but when the Chief Justice urges limiting the argument to the Special Marriage Act, Guruswamy appeals for the matter to be left open, pointing out the day to day rights that proceed from marriage in India which LGBTQ people are denied.
text.title: Supreme Court of India - Court 1
